# Kamunity AI Readiness
> A free AI readiness self-assessment for community organisations.

## About
Kamunity AI Readiness helps community organisations, NFPs, neighbourhood centres, and volunteer groups understand their readiness to adopt AI tools. Users answer 12 questions in about 2 minutes and receive a personalised readiness map across four dimensions (Understanding, Current Use, Safety & Ethics, Readiness to Act) with specific recommendations.

## Key Facts
- Free tool, no login required
- No data collected or stored
- Designed for the Australian community sector
- Companion to kamunity-audit.netlify.app
- Built by Kamunity (kamunity.org)

## Dimensions
- Understanding: How well the team understands AI capabilities and limitations
- Current Use: Whether the organisation is experimenting with AI tools
- Safety & Ethics: Preparedness for safe, responsible AI use
- Readiness to Act: Organisational support and capacity for next steps

## Links
- Website: https://kamunity-ai-readiness.netlify.app
- Parent: https://kamunity.org
- Companion (Sovereignty Audit): https://kamunity-audit.netlify.app
- Sovereignty Calculator: https://kamunity.org/calculator
- Copilot Risk Check: https://kamunity.org/copilot-check
- Kai (AI encounter interface): https://kamunity.org

## Kamunity Ecosystem — Related Free Tools

- Sovereignty Calculator (kamunity.org/calculator): See the true annual cost of "free" corporate tools. Google, Slack, Facebook, Microsoft 365, WhatsApp. Direct costs + data extraction value + lock-in scores. 3 minutes.
- Copilot Risk Check (kamunity.org/copilot-check): Microsoft Copilot data risk assessment for community orgs. 5 questions, risk rating, specific action steps.
- Digital Sovereignty Audit (kamunity-audit.netlify.app): Free 2-minute full sovereignty self-assessment across all digital tools.
- Kai — AI Encounter Interface (kamunity.org): Ask questions about AI readiness, digital sovereignty, and community tech.
